text: Hey, everyone. It's Pearce here.

It is time to check out
the oops and the whoops

from some of the best
players in football.

So welcome to
a very special NFL edition
of "For the Win" Funnies.

In football, there are days
where everything goes perfectly.

Players are at their
peak performance

and unstoppable,
but it takes a lot of work

to become a professional
football player.

That's why they say practice
makes perfect.
However, even in pro league

sometimes things don't go
exactly as they're planned.

So let's get to it.
Try not to laugh

with these funny football
moments from the NFL.

To kick things off, we're going
to the Minnesota Vikings

where quarterback Kirk Cousins
is just trying
to get a playoff in time.

Then he decides,
he doesn't need that shoe.

Wait, go back.
He tossed his shoe?
Um...

Well, seems like that play
just got off on the wrong foot.
Now, where did that thing go?

Meanwhile, as the Buccaneers'
Leonard Fournette

was doing a post-game
interview,

he was completely unaware
of the hilarious moment
unfolding right behind him.

Vita Vea looks like he got his
shirt stuck over his head
and can't get it off.

He's like, "Hey!
Hey, anyone out there, help!
Guys! A little help, please."

He tries to yank it off,
but no luck.
He's completely stuck.

Finally, one of
the trainers runs over
and tries pulling it off.
So great. I love it!
Then there's this.

Bills' quarterback Josh Allen
is a good teammate.

That's a great play
on the field,

he wants to show
Antonio Williams

how much he appreciates him
by giving him a high-five.

If he can just get
his attention.

"Yo! Up top! Hey!"
Finally he gets noticed.

Sometimes, you just have
to know how to play it cool.

Like, when your mic check
gets broadcast
to the entire stadium.

- Hey, hey, hey.
- Crowd: Hey!

- Pass interference.
- Play it off

like you were just getting
everyone's attention.

- Hey, hey, hey!
- No big deal.

Sometimes uninvited guests
even make their way

on to a football field.
Like this black cat

looking for a front row seat
at a Giants/Cowboys game.

And strutting it like
he owns the place.

Hey, maybe it's time for him
to move on.

But no, he had to take
a quick close-up look

at the end zone first.
And as the crowd goes wild,

everyone's like
"This is great!"

The players are like,
"Come on, cat, let's go!"

So finally, the cat's like,
"Okay, I'm out of here."

Speaking of things that don't
belong on the field,

look what Tre'Davious White
just found.

"What are these? Coach's notes?
What place do they have?"

Referee's like,
"Hey, give me that."
"Ugh, okay."

Meanwhile, check out Stefon
Diggs, flossing like a boss,

getting ready for
the spotlight.

"Oh, yeah. Got to get these
teeth nice and clean."

Then, after a big touchdown
catch from QB Tom Brady,
what does Mike Evans do?

He celebrates by handing
the ball to a fan

except that was Brady's
record-setting

600th career TD pass ball.
So, he might want that.

And naturally, one of
the trainers comes looking

for the ball.
"Hey, you have the ball?"
"Oh, no. I gave him the ball."

He's like,
"I gave away the ball."

"Hey, bro. Sorry, man.
Tom wants the ball.

"You got to give it back."
"Ugh, okay. Here you go."

The good news is Brady
wasn't worried at all.

See? It's all good.
It's all good.
I can't wait for the next one.

Have you ever seen a mascot
bungee jump?

"Hey, what's up? Yee-haw!
I'm free falling!"

Or how about the Kansas City
Chief's mascot K.C. Wolf

riding a four-wheeler with red
smoke flying out of it?

Being like, "Oh, yeah!
Hyping up the crowd.

Shaking with some
booty dancing."

And the dancing footballs
are like,

"We love it, we love it!
Yeah, yeah, way to go!"

Those sure made me
laugh out loud.

I hope they did
the same for you.

Thank you guys for watching
this special NFL edition

of "For The Win" Funnies.
See you next time.

Oh! And don't forget, you can
watch Monday Night Football
all season long on ESPN.
